snippet: North Korea has sent out jamming signals since Saturday in an apparent attempt to disrupt civilian and military air and ground traffic in South Korea, officials said.
abstract: Government officials in South Korea accuse North Korea of sending out jamming signals apparently in an attempt to disrupt civilian and military air and ground traffic in South Korea, forcing 252 commercial flights to switch off their global positioning devices.
lead_paragraph: North Korea has sent out jamming signals since Saturday in an apparent attempt to disrupt civilian and military air and ground traffic in South Korea, officials said.

headline.seo: Seoul Says North Korea Tries to Disrupt Air Navigation
headline.main: Seoul Says North Korea Tries to Disrupt Air Navigation
headline.print_headline: South Korea: North Accused of Sending Jamming Signals to Disrupt GPS
